===Etymology===
Possibly from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=どら}} compound {{m|zh|銅鑼|tr=dung la|lit=copper + gong}}. Alternatively, coined in Japan from {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived components.

The reading represents a likely sound shift from the expected [[音読み#Japanese|on'yomi]] of ''dōra''.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|どら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

{{ja-noun|どら}}

# a [[gong]]

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|ゴング}}

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|銅鑼焼き|どらやき}}: literally “gong-bake”: a kind of [[confection]] consisting of two small [[cake]]s baked to resemble [[gong]]s, sandwiching a filling of sweet [[azuki]] bean paste
* {{ja-r|銅鑼声|どらごえ}}: literally “gong voice”: a [[hoarse]] [[voice]], vaguely similar to the way a [[gong]] can sound very [[brash]]
